title: Early 19th c reps of landscape and working class

content.question: The first painting is Boat-Building near Flatford Mill (1815) by John Constable, and the second one is The Angelus (1857–1859) by Jean François Millet. How does each painting reflect the views of landscape and labor held by the artists and their contemporaries?

frqParts.text: The first painting is Boat-Building near Flatford Mill (1815) by John Constable, and the second one is The Angelus (1857–1859) by Jean François Millet. How does each painting reflect the views of landscape and labor held by the artists and their contemporaries?

topic.text: 4.1: Interactions Within and Across Cultures in Later European and American Art

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Explain how artistic decisions about form, style, materials, technique, and/or content shape a work of art (or group of related works of art).
